@MONOREN Jeg gir de seriøst hver eneste krone jeg får til bursdag og jul i 5 år hvis det betyr at vi kan få laminat i stedet.

@MONOREN Jepp, sannsynligvis erstattet med nytt teppe. Vi skal diskutere det i dag men foreldrene virker ikke åpne til laminat pga pris. De har allerede kjøpt sofa, peis og gardiner uten å konsultere oss så jeg rister av sinne.
I’d just like to say that I loathe wall to wall carpeting with the burning passion of a thousand exploding suns. That is all.
@Artists_Ali I swear to god I have tweeted this exact same thing before

RIP Stephen Hawking. An extraordinarily funny man who brought science to the masses. He wrote the foreword to a family friend’s book, an immense source of pride to said friend. He will be missed, but his impact will live on.
@muslimah_han @DavidLammy I’m really sad Stephen Hawking has died, and seeing abled people use us as inspiration porn and judge our value by productivity isn’t going to help.

@DavidLammy One does not “overcome” disabilities. One learns to cope with them. What disabled ppl overcome is society’s lack of access. We do not exist to inspire abled people, and all disabled people are worthy regardless of their productivity.
@KatyHolliday And before you ask for it, here’s my source. I suggest you read it cos you’re out of your depth here. You might learn something. https://t.co/gCS96E9U70

@KatyHolliday Inflammation. Do you know what has been scientifically proven to cause inflammation? Dieting. That’s why inflammation often seen in fat people. Correlation isn’t causation, sweetheart. And how dare I expect a medical research charity to know the difference?!🙄

@KatyHolliday Oh silly me, there I go again expecting medical advice to based on scientific fact. Adiposity does not cause cancer, bad habits cause cancer, and bad habits aren’t exclusive to fat people. You know what does cause cancer though?

@Artists_Ali I think about this a lot. When climate change is questioned, the science has been manipulated. When the traditional weight loss paradigm is challenged, questioning study sample sizes or research funding is “grasping at straws”.
@VelveteenFemme They run ads saying obesity causes cancer but on their website they admit that a causal link hasn’t been established. They’re disgusting.

Robin had to get up in the middle of the night last night to chase away a fox. I wish that was a euphemism, in reality our neighbourhood is full of foxes that wake us up with their obnoxious noise-making. They’re cute though.
@jackieaina Nooo, the stuffing is the only good part! The cookie parts taste like literal dirt

Our new sofas have honest to gawd USB ports. I don’t want to live with these things. Also big shock, they are majorly uncomfortable, I mean duh, they are recliners, they keep chiropractors in high demand. I would welcome an assassin at this point. Me or the sofas, whichever.

@sara_oldfield Pretty much every relationship in existence is a mixed-weight relationship. It’s a bs term used as an excuse to prod thin men about how they could possibly be attracted to and want to be with a fat woman, fatphobia and misogyny in harmony.

@_KelseyMaggart @emilyslooks You’re absolutely right. Having a pretty face and the right measurements isn’t enough to be a good model. Her print work is lifeless and dull and her runway is mediocre at best. Nepotism rules modelling these days, which I wouldn’t mind as much if those models had talent.

Our hideous sofas are coming tomorrow and I’m dreading it like the plague. You just don’t understand how ugly they are. I’ll be ready to cover the monstrosities up with cushions, throws and blankets. You have no idea. Just.. ugh
